Prem are different than than in the cloud and here's how when we ask our
customers what their challenges are on Prem storage backup primary you name it
we get pretty much three very concrete answers first there's the the cost
component capex versus op X second there's the deployment component you know how you have to sort of be beholden
to other people's inventory you can't just deploy things you know in a one-click manner the way you can in the cloud somebody actually has to plan
it out there's a supply chain component there they're shipping there's rack and stack
there's an integration with your data center architecture and then there's the
repeatability component most customers don't deploy things in the sorts of volumes that would inspire them to put
down repeatable processes that are totally you know failure proof which
makes compliance somewhat of a doozy and when I say that what I mean is if you
look at gear that's been deployed over generations of employees or over generations of projects it's really
common that they were all deployed in a slightly different way and that makes auditing somewhat of a challenge so our
answer to that is that what we would like for customers is would like for
them to get all the benefits of being able to deploy things in the cloud but
still get the control part in the choice part and so we we offer a set of services underlying services our
building blocks that customers are always free to use but we also have gaps very frequently between what those
services can provide what customers need so for example what story deuce does isn't done natively by
any of our services and so that's where what we call the partner ecosystem comes in and the partner ecosystem applies
that partner word is very special it applies to what we call the APN or the Amazon partner network so the Amazon
partner network is as as it sounds a network of partners but there's two kinds of partners there's consulting
partners and there's there's a technology partner so store reduce is a technology partner and they're actually
one of my favorite technology partners because they follow that that age-old UNIX philosophy of do one thing and do
it well and so you know when when you look at deploying an APN technology
partner it should meet all of these criteria that you see on the screen it should be really easy to deploy which
